meanings.definition: In a shy or timid manner.
meanings.sent1: She spoke shyly to the new student.
meanings.sent2: He smiled shyly when complimented on his drawing.
meanings.sent3: The kitten approached the big dog shyly, unsure of what to expect.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed shyly in the early morning light.
meanings.sent5: The child peeked shyly from behind the curtain, curious about the noise outside.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of confidence or reserve.
meanings.sent1: Her shyly demeanor made her seem distant to others.
meanings.sent2: The shyly student avoided speaking up in class.
meanings.sent3: The shyly puppy hid behind its owner's legs at the park.
meanings.sent4: The shyly colors of the painting blended into the background.
meanings.sent5: The shyly boy's eyes avoided meeting anyone else's gaze in the room.
